name: Website Documentation
description: This document provides technical descriptions of how your Business Catalyst site has been developed and should be used by the site owner or their web master as a reference for making custom changes or understanding how the particular features of BC have been implemented for this particular website
intro:
This site should provide you with sufficient detail to allow you to understand how the different features incorporated into your website have been implemented by way of BC modules. The details provided are for your own particular website and assume you already have a working knowledge in the use of Business Catalyst.
We do not encourage clients to make changes to the layouts in any site templates or module layouts unless you have a deep understanding of HTML and CSS and invariably, some understanding of Javascript. Making such changes will impact many parts of your site and can lead to serious problems.
If you are at all unsure about what you want to do, please contact us through the support portal (see buttons above) or phone us on 0419 706 325. All change requests or problems with your site MUST be logged by way of a support ticket by either logging into our support portal or by sending an email to us via the above button.

sections.title: Architecture
sections.content:
Site Design - Template / Framework

BC Template  
Base template/theme  
Source
  
Responsive Layout

Responsive Framework   Version  
   

 

Your website has been developed on the Adobe Business Catalyst platform. If you have not yet acquainted yourself with this system and its wide range of features and modules you may do so by either reviewing these at our website at http://topleftdesigns.com.au/services/business_catalyst.htm or for more detail by visiting the main website at Business Catalyst http://businesscatalyst.com/features

Access to online training for Business Catalyst can be found at http://docs.businesscatalyst.com/support

Access to your site is via your usual domain with /admin appended to the end. You will then be required to login to the BC administration console via the admin username and password we have setup for you.

Once in to the site you will find the administration dashboard and menu options giving you access to the full range of options available to you.

Data / Content Types

Your site is comprised of different data that makes up your overall site. The sorts of data held in yru BC site to which you have access is:

  • Site Templates for controlling how yur overal lpages ae presented in a consistent manner
  • Module templates that control how data held in specific BC Modules are presented
  • System Pages and email layouts & content
  • static web pages
  • Web Forms used for capture of information on different pages of your site
  • Content Holders for commonly used HTML code in any part of your site
  • CSS files that control the style settings for the content presented
  • JS or Javascript files that provide certain processing of page content within your browser
  • Images and Videos used witin your site's pages and modules
  • CRM data
  • Web Apps which ae custom databases utilised witin your site
  • Module data
  • eCommerce related data arund products and product catalogs, tax and shipping
  • Site Settings

Folder Content

If you manage your site pages via the Tree View or view your site via the file manager you will see the overall file structure for your site as illustrated below. The details of what is held in any of these folders which you need to be concerned follow.

  • /
    • _assets
    • _dev
    • fonts
    • interventions
    • ModuleTemplates
    • stylesheets
    • uploads
    • Workshops
    • Index (Start Page for soul-healers.worldsecuresystems.com and 1 others)

Your site is incusive of certain Web Forms used for capture of information by visitors to the site who wish to submit general enquiries, bookings or purchase goods. The forms used within your site are as follows:

Form name ID Details

sections.title: Modules
sections.content:
Blogs

Create, configure, customize and integrate with social media. Make your blog part of your online business.

Events

Promote and manage simple events, using sign-up forms and payment collection, capacity limits and automate follow-up emails prior to the event date.

Photo galleries

Turn a folder containing images into a photo gallery, easy to manage and distribute across your site.

Media downloads

Let users download media such as PDF files, Word documents, videos, and music.

News

Keep your site up to date and visitors informed. Use the AJAX enabled news module for a smooth user experience.

Forums

Enable community discussions through a forum. Let visitors post freely or moderate comments before they go live.

FAQ

Users will always have questions. Stay prepared and provide essential answers through the AJAX enabled FAQ module.

Ad Rotators

Use the ad rotator module and spare the time to code scripts that automatically swap images.

sections.title: Site Settings
sections.content:
Categories

 

Domain DNS  Settings

Your email is being hosted with BC as part of your hosting plan.

The following domains are being managed internally within yru BC site:

  1. www.yourdomain.com.au (set as the default domain)
  2. yourdomain.com.au - this domain has been redirected to the www default domain

Secure Zones

No secure zones have been implemented within your site.

Categories

No specific  categories have been utilised within yur site

Google Analytics

Google Analytics and Webmaster have been set up on your default domain.

You have been granted access to these accounts through yoru Google Account:

sections.title: Training
sections.content:
Introduction to Business Catalyst

To familiarise yourself with Business Catalyst you should take a look at this video -
What is Business Catalyst? - http://docs.businesscatalyst.com/videos/getting-started/what-is-business-catalyst-2

Other topics we have selected from those available we suggest you look at by way of an introduction to BC are as follows:

Introducing the Business Catalyst Admin Console

Discover the admin interface and learn about every step involved in using it, from login and password recovery to dashboard layout and functionality.

Site hosting plans - Australian pricing

Discover the admin interface and learn about every step involved in using it, from login and password recovery to dashboard layout and functionality.

How to add or edit your website's content

The WYSIWYG. The Develop tab. Dreamweaver. Muse. The In Context Editor.

The WYSIWYG content editor

Learn how to use the What You See Is What You Get editor. Customize editor options such as fonts and CSS rules.

How to upload files to your site

Upload a file using the File Manager. Preview a file. SFTP and Develop mode.

Following this we have a number of tutorials on our own site that you can log into from this link - http://topleftdesigns.com.au/resources/bc-training-tutorials

YOUR LOGIN CREDENTIALS ARE-

Username:

Password: 

Once the library loads you will find a range of videos not all of which are relevant. I would however suggest the following to introduce you to BC concepts and general features…

  1. Getting Started:  Logging Into Your Admin Backend
  2. Content Editing: Uploading and Inserting Photos, Positioning and Styling Photos ; Learn to enter content with copy and paste
  3. Customers: Managing Customer Records
  4. Marketing: Organizing, Editing, Deleting Email Campaigns

Custom Training Videos for Your Site

The following videos have been put together specific to yuor site and provide more indepth information on how to maintain key aspects of your website.
